item.description:
Meet in the parking lot at 10:30

The address given points to a residential street just east of the refuge entrance. Please look at the trail map on the following link:

http://www.fws.gov/no...


Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge

The refuge, part of the National Wildlife Refuge System, encompasses 3.5 square miles located within the towns of Hudson , Maynard, Stow and Sudbury . Dogs are not allowed. The refuge comprises over 2,200 acres of varied woodland, wetland, fields, ponds and streams, with historical and archeological sites. The terrain is primarily flat but includes some prominent hills; elevations range from 170 feet near the river to 320 feet on Walnut Hill. Seventy percent of the refuge is forested with pine, oak and maple. There are over 470 acres of diverse wetland habitat including an Atlantic white cedar swamp. This jewel is connected to about 1,000 acres of other diverse protected space.

From the east, to get to the main entrance:
Take Rte 27 to Sudbury Center then take a left to head west on Hudson Road for about 1 and a half miles.
Look for the parking lot of the Sudbury, Marlborough State Forest on the right.

The land was transferred from the Dept of Defense to the Fish and Wildlife Service in 2000, and Mapquest still shows it as the US Army Training Area ? Sudbury.


I have lunch reservations for 12 people at 1:00 at
Sky Restaurant Sudbury
120 Boston Post Road
Sudbury, MA 01776
Tel: 1.978.440.8855

http://www.sky-restau...
item.name: Assabet River National Wildlife Refuge
